TopicTitle: Why aren't my mods showing up?

Articles.Content:
My mods aren't showing up,

i've installed the latest module manager, Firespitter and other required mods.

Did you take your KSP download and make a new copy of it in a different directory? And then mod that copy in that directory? If so, exactly what are you doing to launch the game?

In any case, posting a screenshot of the contents of your GameData folder of the modded copy of your game would probably be very helpful.

Moving to Add-on Discussion.

4 hours ago, Blast-off said:

My mods aren't showing up,

Gonna need more info than that-- this is basically the equivalent of walking into an auto garage and saying to a mechanic "My car doesn't work, what should I do".  First thing he's going to want is to see the car-- not really any advice he could offer without that. 

4 hours ago, bewing said:

p﻿osting a screenshot of the contents of your GameData folder

^ this would be a good start.  One common reason why people's mods "don't work" is because they're not correctly installed, i.e. the person has misunderstood the installation instructions or something.  A screenshot of your GameData folder could be helpful, so we can at least verify that you've got stuff in the correct location.

This happened to me too. I wanted to get some mods, but they weren't showing up. This made me confused and I ended up having to reinstall KSP... long story. Anyway, I realized that the only mods that were showing up were the ones for my current version. If they were older, they wouldn't work. Now I only get the newest mods. So... Yeah. Check if your mods are new enough. If they are and they still don't work, then I have no idea... mods aren't really my area of expertise
I' Already take screenshot, so what now?

9 hours ago, Blast-off said:

I' Already take screenshot, so what now?

You go to imgur or any other image hosting site, upload it and then post a link here.
